messages.subject: Re: Breastfeeding  WAS: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Barbie
messages.messageBody:
From: <HaHaMommy@...>

<<NOT in florida ... Female flesh is illegal!! I saw a pic once of a woman
being dragged off the beach, wearing only two pieces of paper, crying "I'm
covered by the Constitution!!!">>


No we actually do have topless and nude beaches here. Clearly marked. We
also have word of mouth gay beaches too. Never any problems with the ones in
my local area.

Mary B

messages.subject: Re: Breastfeeding  WAS: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Barbie
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4-27-2003 7:10:33 PM Mountain Daylight Time, ... NOT in florida ... Female flesh is illegal!!  I saw a pic once of a woman being dragged off
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4-27-2003 7:10:33 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
jmcseals@... writes:

> Women roam topless on a beach
> but stick a baby to the breast and suddenly everyone is mortified.
>

NOT in florida ... Female flesh is illegal!! I saw a pic once of a woman
being dragged off the beach, wearing only two pieces of paper, crying "I'm
covered by the Constitution!!!"

diana,
The wackiest widow westriver...
“I prefer to be true to myself, even at the hazard of incurring the ridicule
of others, rather than to be false, and to incur my own abhorrence.”
--Frederick Douglass

messages.subject: Re: Breastfeeding  WAS: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Barbie
messages.messageBody:
From: "jmcseals SEALS" <jmcseals@...>

<<Wasn't Florida where the woman was kicked out of Fundie-Mart, er, uh
Wal-Mart for nursing in public?? Shameful! Women roam topless on a beach
but stick a baby to the breast and suddenly everyone is mortified.>>


I have never encountered any problem here in FL with nursing anywhere in
public. No one has ever said anything to more or given me anything but
approving looks. If there were offended people, I never saw them.

Mary B

messages.subject: Breastfeeding  WAS: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Barbie
messages.msgSnippet: ****What a difference to Florida, where apparently nursing moms do not exist.  Let me also mention for those of us who had trouble enough, it did not ease our
messages.messageBody:
****What a difference to
Florida, where apparently nursing moms do not exist. Let me also
mention for those of us who had trouble enough, it did not ease our
transition into public life.****

Wasn't Florida where the woman was kicked out of Fundie-Mart, er, uh
Wal-Mart for nursing in public?? Shameful! Women roam topless on a beach
but stick a baby to the breast and suddenly everyone is mortified.

The soap box is getting bubbly!
Jennifer
